Params: {3: "The hurricane devours all emptiness as Liv's voice resonates through the entire space."}
{3: 'Yet that unyielding will meets no resistance. Instead, a gentle stream of soft white light answers its call.'}
{3: "It envelops Liv's consciousness with a warm tenderness, like waves gently yielding to the evening breeze. All her fierce emotions quietly dissolve, fading before they can ever find an echo."}
{1: 'The world begins with a lingering sigh.', 3: '45'}
{3: 'The world begins with a lingering sigh.'}
{1: 'Spring buds awaken; the summer sun warms; autumn air chills; deep winter snow comforts.', 3: '45'}
{3: 'Spring buds awaken; the summer sun warms; autumn air chills; deep winter snow comforts.'}
{1: 'The seasons cycle in a silent, seamless procession.', 3: '45'}
{3: 'The seasons cycle in a silent, seamless procession.'}
{3: 'Coming to her senses, Liv slowly opens her eyes, feeling dazed for a moment before rubbing them.'}
{3: 'Her thoughts remain hazy. It feels as though she has surfaced from a very long dream, a trace of moisture still lingering at the corners of her eyes.'}
{3: 'The bizarre, kaleidoscopic dreamscapes recede as clarity returns, leaving only shadowy impressions behind. No matter how hard she tries, she cannot grasp a single detail.'}
{3: 'She blinks, a profound fatigue still nestled deep within her limbs.'}
{3: 'A gentle knock at the door pulls Liv from her thoughts. As she opens it, sunlight floods the room, bathing everything in a brilliant, golden glow.'}
{3: 'The title escapes her lips in a daze as the mist clouding her memories begins to dissolve.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aisling', 3: 'Mom, look! I found lots of fruits again today!', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The little girl eagerly holds up a basket brimming with bright red fruits, her face alight with pride.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "...That's wonderful, Aisling. But you must promise me to stay away from the mining area, okay?", 4: '1'}
{3: "A tender smile touches Liv's lips as she takes the basket, its size comically large in the little girl's small hands."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Alright, go wash your hands now. Lunch will be ready soon.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Excitement and happiness flush the little girl's cheeks. She nods vigorously and dashes toward the sink."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aisling', 3: 'Mom, are we having those sandwiches you promised yesterday?', 4: '18'}
{3: 'Her nod is almost instinctual as she turns toward the cupboard. Inside, the bread, vegetables, and lunch meat are already neatly arranged, just as they were "yesterday."'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Of course we are, sweetie. I promised you yesterday, didn't I?", 4: '18'}
{3: 'From the cupboard, her gaze sweeps over this modest little house, mentally tracing every object in sight.'}
{3: 'Its shelves are stacked with fairy tales her mother once read to her, nestled alongside the medical texts her father used to study.'}
{1: '1', 2: "Liv's Mother", 3: 'All wounded creatures were sent to Eden to heal. Once recovered, the maiden returned them to the mortal world.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Liv's Mother", 3: 'She was a deity of this realm, an "angel" to all living things...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her childhood was steeped in love, a foundation that let her grow in peace.'}
{3: 'She remembers the medal of honor on the shelf.'}
{3: "When the Punishing Virus erupted and Babylonia ascended into space, she joined the military with her parents' support, becoming a field medic."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Why the rush...? Can't we wait for the other soldiers to retreat first? We tried so hard to save them...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "What's the point of this war...? Did I really save those lives...?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She earned the medal the day she disobeyed a direct retreat order, choosing instead to pull thirty-five wounded soldiers from a single, hellish battle.'}
{3: 'She remembers the desk buried under stacks of research materials and academic papers.'}
{3: "The injuries from that battle had grounded her, making a frontline medic's post untenable."}
{1: '1', 3: 'So, she channeled that same resolve into a new purpose, pursuing a degree in Construct Medical Science and joining the Star of Life as a Construct.'}
{3: 'These four simple words effortlessly summarize years of suffering.'}
{3: 'The crimson Punishing Virus, the endless battlefronts, the freezing winds, the relentless combat—'}
{3: 'All of it was eventually confined to the pages of history books, concluded by the final period of the last combat report.'}
{3: 'With the Punishing Virus effectively contained, humanity began its long-awaited return to Earth. To their home.'}
{3: 'And by her own choice, Liv returned too—accompanied by a commandant—and settled down in this conservation area, a place graced with vast, untamed fields of flowers...'}

{3: 'The sound of a key turning in the lock snaps Liv from her memories. She looks up abruptly, a wave of involuntary joy lifting her heart. She turns toward the door, a smile already gracing her lips—'}
{3: 'The child jumps with excitement, rushing to join Liv in welcoming the returning figure.'}
{3: "The syllable catches in your throat. It's as if your mind has been frozen solid, locked in rust, and is only now, haltingly, beginning to turn again."}
{3: 'Who are you? Where are you... What are you... doing right now?'}
{3: 'The confusion surges, a swift and dizzying tide, but it just as quickly recedes, washed away by the welcoming voices near your ears.'}
{3: 'They are your family, the people you live with.'}

{3: 'Sunlight floods the modest room, filling it with a palpable warmth. On the table sits a vase of white roses, brought home by you just yesterday. The scent of fresh bread and steaming soup rises to meet you, a comforting aroma of grains and home.'}
{3: 'This is the one you love, your... wife.'}

{3: 'Sunlight floods the modest room, filling it with a palpable warmth. On the table sits a vase of white roses, brought home by you just yesterday. The scent of fresh bread and steaming soup rises to meet you, a comforting aroma of grains and home.'}
{3: 'Though memory insists you have called each other by such endearments for a long time, the word still kindles a shyness on her lips and a flush of color across her cheeks.'}
{3: 'Everything before you seems so perfect, so happy. And yet, a dissonant note hums deep within you.'}
{3: 'Before you can grasp it, a voice from the depths of your consciousness offers a gentle reminder:'}
{1: '11', 2: "<size=50>Don't bring your work troubles back home. That's not good.</size>", 4: '50', 9: '3', 11: '1'}
{3: "Don't bring your work troubles back home. That's not good."}
{3: 'That subtle unease dissolves as the child rushes into your arms, her small, warm body a perfect anchor.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'I picked lots of wild fruits again today!', 4: '1'}
{2: "That's wonderful, Aisling!", 3: '283', 4: 'Oh really? How many did you get? Tell me about it.', 5: '281', 6: '...', 7: '283'}
{3: 'She stretches her little arms wide, trying to form a circle as big as possible.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Alright, come wash your hands. Lunch's almost ready.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A gentle breeze stirs the white curtains, and the afternoon sun bathes the dining table in a golden glow—the perfect scene for a casual chat.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'You left so early this morning. Is everything alright at the conservation area?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Your memories gradually piece themselves together with each question.'}
{2: 'Yeah, it was about the conservation area.', 3: '302', 4: 'The conservation area supervisor wanted to see me.', 5: '302'}
{3: 'After retiring from Babylonia, you and Liv chose to settle in this conservation area, where you were assigned the role of patrol captain.'}
{2: 'They reported another sighting of Hetero-Creatures in Conservation Area 375.', 3: '304'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Again...? Even the new filter isn't working?", 4: '1'}
{2: "It's too soon to tell what happened.", 3: '308'}
{3: 'As the logic settles into place in your mind, the ensuing conversation begins to flow more naturally.'}
{2: 'Area 375 has gone completely dark. We only heard about it from a couple of refugees who got out.', 3: '310'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Refugees...? Has it really gotten that bad?', 4: '1'}
{2: "I'm afraid so. They're at the medical station now. Melinoe is with them.", 3: '312'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'And Area 375 is so close to us... Do we know anything else?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The World Government has yet to issue any response to the situation. It is unclear whether this is due to being overextended by a widespread Punishing Virus outbreak or another unknown factor.'}
{3: 'The patrol team received a situational update from the supervisor this morning. You have been directed to increase your patrol frequency and implement night shifts.'}
{3: "Liv's gaze settles on Aisling, who sits quietly to the side, obediently eating her bread with a fork. A soft sigh escapes Liv's lips."}
{2: "We're increasing patrols. That should keep us safe for now.", 3: '322'}
{2: "We've been through worse with the Punishing Virus. We made it through that; we can handle this.", 3: '327'}
{3: 'Why does she feel compelled to call 【kuroname】 "Commandant"? The person retired long ago...'}
{3: 'Yet, the title is etched into her mind, indelible and persistent.'}
{3: 'Shoving the dissonance aside, Liv presses her lips together and forces a smile.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "You're right. Why worry about tomorrow's troubles when we still have today's sunshine?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'And we still have our residence rights on Babylonia, if it comes to that.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "If things get dangerous, we could send Aisling back to Babylonia first. She'd be safe there, at least.", 4: '1'}
{2: "We'll send both you and Aisling back to Babylonia.", 3: '345', 4: 'What about you?', 5: '345'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I'll be here, of course. Protecting our home, right alongside you. I am a decorated lieutenant, you know. Don't you forget it.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'I would never underestimate the esteemed Lieutenant.', 3: '348', 4: "Yes, ma'am!", 5: '348'}
{3: "A full thirty minutes slips by, measured only by the wall clock's silent sweep."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Well, it's getting late. I should get back to that project Star of Life assigned me...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'And I should go check on the patrols.', 3: '356'}
{2: 'See you tonight, Liv.', 3: '358', 4: 'See you tonight... honey.', 5: '359'}
{3: "Even now, after all this time, the term of endearment sends a flush of warmth to the tips of Liv's ears."}
{3: 'With a shy smile, she quickens her pace to catch up, returning a gentle embrace.'}
{3: 'Afternoon work hours always feel paradoxically long, yet the time slips away all the same.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Liv sits at her desk, analyzing a batch of files transmitted from the Star of Life by Professor Hippocrates.'}
{3: 'Their new joint research project aims to deconstruct and analyze Construct M.I.N.D., optimizing its fundamental operational structures.'}
{3: 'The professor seems to have acquired significant new data. Liv is carefully cross-referencing the information, absorbed in dissecting the complex contents, when suddenly...'}
{3: "The little girl, clutching a jar of candy, tugs gently at Liv's clothes."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Liv pulls her chair back and lifts Aisling onto her lap—a gesture that echoes a comforting memory from her own childhood.'}
{3: 'She points insistently at the jar. No child could resist the colorful, translucent treasures inside.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Just one piece today, okay? Too many will make you sick.', 4: '1'}

{3: 'With a deft twist, Liv opens the lid, and Aisling carefully selects her favorite color. A triumphant cheer escapes her as she secures the prize, and then she dashes from the room, holding the candy aloft.'}
{3: "As the child runs toward the central plaza, Liv settles back into her seat, immersing herself once more in the terminal's data stream."}
{1: '1', 3: "That's when she finds it: a tiny variable hidden deep within the dataset. It isn't a value, but something more nebulous. A hypothesis, or perhaps a new possibility altogether."}
{3: "Her thoughts drift to the nature of the M.I.N.D.—the complex region that houses a Construct's consciousness, with memories stored in countless intricate forms..."}
{3: "A sudden realization hits her. How does she know the M.I.N.D.'s internal structure in such detail...? Isn't she a human...?"}
{3: 'Before she can trace the source of this unsettling discrepancy, a small hand tugs at her hem again. Aisling is back.'}
{3: "The child looks up, seemingly confident that her mother won't refuse such a request."}
{3: "Liv crouches down to meet the child's gaze."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "You've already had one piece today. Any more, and you might get sick.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'I know you think that, but our bodies have their own rules, sweetie.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Think of your tummy like a little house. It only has room for one candy, one sandwich, and one bowl of gruel at a time.', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Liv', 3: "You've already had one piece of candy and one sandwich today. If we put a second candy in there, the first candy will get upset. They might even start fighting in your little house, Aisling.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "And if the candy takes up all the space, the dinner gruel won't have anywhere to go.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Aisling stares at Liv with childlike bewilderment.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'But Melinoe always used to give me more...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "It's not good to ask for things without restraint, Aisling.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Whether it's Melinoe or the supervisor, you shouldn't ask for candy without restraint.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Restraint means "self-control." A good child should learn to control their desires. It\'s part of growing up healthy and strong.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Noticing Aisling's lingering confusion, Liv checks her terminal. It's already six."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Would you like to help me make a fruit platter with those wild fruits you collected today?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'We can make it look like a little lamb and share it with everyone at dinner. How does that sound?', 4: '2'}
{3: "The child's attention is clearly captured by this new, exciting activity."}
{3: "Liv smiles, shuts her terminal, and takes Aisling's hand as they leave the small study together."}
{3: 'Night falls, and the lights begin to twinkle like a scattered constellation. From the small kitchen window, a warm, inviting glow spills into the dusk.'}

{1: "Usually, it merely has to ask, or rather, it doesn't even need to do that. Its nurturer readily offers everything she has, an endless wellspring of devotion.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: 'It has drawn endless darkness from its nurturer.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: 'It knows the metallic, bloody taste of pain;', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: 'it knows the gritty, salt-and-sand texture of sorrow.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 8: '1'}

{1: "It has extracted all suffering from its nurturer's M.I.N.D., feasting on the despair. Yet, there was one thing it had never understood...", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: 'Its sense of taste awakened as if for the first time. A rich, golden sweetness—like distilled autumn—bloomed and rolled across its tongue.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: 'It devoured the sensation with a near-violent greed; it never knew the world could hold such vibrant colors.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 8: '1'}

{1: 'Bewildered, it didn\'t know what reaction to "fabricate." It could only repeat its demand in confusion.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: 'It was denied, and yet... it somehow gained more.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: 'The wild fruits have a more "fragrant" quality than candy.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: "It's an essence difficult to capture in words, encompassing a crisp texture, a slight tartness, and a more layered aroma.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}

{1: "It loses itself in Liv's M.I.N.D., reading the colors of flowers and inhaling the scent of damp soil.", 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStoryFront/BgStoryFront43.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 9: '1'}
{3: 'A distant whisper trembles through the net.'}
{1: '53', 2: '<size=35>She will be mine... She will obey me. She will belong to me.</size>', 3: '350', 4: '-130', 9: '3', 11: '1'}
{3: 'She will be mine... She will obey me. She will belong to me.'}
{1: '55', 2: '<size=35>I will make her... and her M.I.N.D. truly mine.</size>', 3: '400', 4: '250', 9: '3', 11: '1'}
{3: 'I will make her... and her M.I.N.D. truly mine.'}
{1: '58', 2: "<size=35>Ah, never mind. It doesn't matter. I want it, and it should be mine.</size>", 3: '-200', 4: '250', 9: '3', 11: '1'}
{3: "Ah, never mind. It doesn't matter. I want it, and it should be mine."}
{3: 'The fragmented whispers gradually fade, swallowed by the starry void.'}
